Method Detail

createConnectorClient

public static ConnectorClient createConnectorClient(java.lang.String protocol)
                                             throws java.net.MalformedURLException
This method provides implementation transparency when creating a new ConnectorClient from the given ServerAddress. Basically it takes the protocol and instantiate the matching ConnectorClient such as RmiConnectorClient. So far there exist only the RmiConnectorClient, but in a future there might be a HttpConnectorClient or a HttpsConnectorClient. This factory considers the corresponding implementation class located in the following package: "org.smartfrog.services.jmx.communication."+protocol+"."+protocol+"ConnectorClient" being "protocol" a String representing the protocol to be used for the remote connection. If it fails to create it, it will return an RmiConnectorClient by default.

Parameters:
protocol - the protocol to connect to remote JMX Agent
Returns:
the apropriate ConnectorClient implementation
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException

createServerAddress

public static ServerAddress createServerAddress(java.lang.String protocol,
                                                java.lang.String host,
                                                int port,
                                                java.lang.Object resource)
                                         throws java.net.MalformedURLException
This method provides implementation transparency when creating a new ConnectorClient from the given ServerAddress. Basically it takes the protocol and instantiate the matching ConnectorClient such as RmiConnectorClient. So far there exist only the RmiConnectorClient, but in a future there might be a HttpConnectorClient or a HttpsConnectorClient. This factory considers the corresponding implementation class located in the following package: "org.smartfrog.services.jmx.communication."+protocol+"."+protocol+"ConnectorClient" being "protocol" a String representing the protocol to be used for the remote connection. If it fails to create it, it will return an RmiConnectorClient by default.

Parameters:
protocol - the protocol to connect to remote JMX Agent
host - the remote host
port - the listening port
resource - name of the resource to reach, such as a name service, file, etc.
Returns:
the apropriate ServerAddress implementation
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException

findMBeanServer

public static javax.management.MBeanServer findMBeanServer(java.lang.String urlStr)
                                                    throws AgentNotFoundException
This method returns a ConnectorClient connected to a deployed remote instance of a JMX Agent whose address is located in "sfAgentName". The "sfAgentName" attribute must contain a valid URL of a ConnectorServer.

Parameters:
urlStr - Description of the Parameter
Returns:
the Connector Client
Throws:
AgentNotFoundException - Description of the Exception
java.rmi.RemoteException - Description of the Exception

                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
